decks.notes: The deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's threats while generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. The deck also has a win condition in Celestial Colonnade and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to close out the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan until it can establish a dominant board state and secure the victory through control and resource management.

The key concept of this deck revolves around generating mana quickly and efficiently through spells such as Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, while also digging through the deck for combo pieces with cards like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed for a lethal Grapeshot finish, utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. Past in Flames allows for recursion of key spells, and Gifts Ungiven helps to search for necessary combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively discard cards from your hand and put powerful creatures onto the battlefield for free, such as Hollow One and Gurmag Angler. By using cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry, you can quickly fill your graveyard and take advantage of cards like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. This deck leverages its graveyard as a resource, allowing you to constantly pressure your opponent and outvalue them in the long run. With a mix of discard, burn, and powerful threats, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful flying spirits such as Supreme Phantom and Spell Queller to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining disruptive creatures with efficient removal in Path to Exile and the ability to flash in creatures with Collected Company, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control throughout the game. The deck also includes mana ramp with Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to ensure a smooth curve and enable powerful plays.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing low-cost, high-damage spells and creatures. The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Skullcrack and Searing Blaze. The main win condition is to burn the opponent out before they have a chance to stabilize or gain control of the game. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear help to maintain the pressure and deal consistent damage, while also being difficult for the opponent to deal with.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful control spells like Cryptic Command and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient removal like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of card draw and filtering spells like Think Twice and Search for Azcanta helps ensure consistency and allows the player to find the right answers at the right time.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats while maintaining card advantage through search effects like Search for Azcanta and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Lightning Bolt to control the board and secure victory. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for consistency in casting spells and activating abilities, with a mix of fetch lands, shock lands, and utility lands like Celestial Colonnade and Field of Ruin. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Secure the Wastes and Snapcaster Mage ensure the deck can close out games efficiently.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a board of cheap artifacts and use them to power up Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating for massive damage. By utilizing cards like Steel Overseer, Memnite, and Signal Pest to pump up your creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. With efficient mana acceleration from Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, along with protection from Welding Jar, this deck is designed to put pressure on the opponent early and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on aggressively lowering your own life total to make Death's Shadow a formidable threat on the battlefield. It also features efficient removal and disruption spells to control the opponent's board while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board dominance through a combination of fast creature plays, disruption, and a well-timed Death's Shadow to close out the game quickly. The careful balance of life total management, removal, and threats make it a potent and lethal Aggro deck in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to generate infinite mana through the synergy between Krark-Clan Ironworks, Myr Retriever, Scrap Trawler, and other artifacts. By sacrificing artifacts and recurring them from graveyard with Retriever and Trawler, the deck aims to loop through its deck, generate infinite mana, draw cards, and eventually win the game through various win conditions. The deck utilizes cards like Ichor Wellspring, Terrarion, and Ancient Stirrings to find its combo pieces quickly, while also having cards like Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb for utility and removal.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently removing threats with removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus. The mana base is optimized for consistency with access to cards like Flooded Strand and Field of Ruin. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while maintaining board control and closing out the game with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Celestial Colonnade.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Bedlam Reveler, Young Pyromancer, and Lingering Souls while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Liliana of the Veil. It also has the ability to control the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Kolaghan's Command. By applying early pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts synergistically to create a fast, aggressive strategy that overwhelms the opponent quickly. By using artifacts like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp out threats like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck can quickly build a board presence. The inclusion of cards like Signal Pest and Vault Skirge also adds to the aggressive nature of the deck, while cards like Arcbound Ravager and Etched Champion provide resilience and versatility. This deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently while leveraging the power of artifacts.

The deck focuses on assembling the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo, utilizing cards like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to generate infinite mana and card advantage. It aims to draw through the deck quickly with Ancient Stirrings and cycle artifacts like Terrarion, while controlling the board with Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb. The deck can consistently tutor for combo pieces with Inventors' Fair and recur key cards from the graveyard with Buried Ruin. By efficiently generating and utilizing resources, the deck can quickly win the game through a powerful and resilient combo.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures and using equipment to pump them up for aggressive attacks. Using cards like Cranial Plating, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage. Inkmoth Nexus and Signal Pest provide evasion and additional damage, while Mox Opal helps ramp up mana for quick plays. The deck is designed to be fast and resilient, with a mix of creatures, artifacts, and instant removal spells to control the board and push for victory.

The key idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill your graveyard with cards like Burning Inquiry, Goblin Lore, and Faithless Looting in order to efficiently cast powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, Gurmag Angler, and Bloodghast. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of threats while also having disruption and removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality. The combination of speed, graveyard synergies, and strong creatures make this Aggro-Hollow One deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.
